page.title: 01Introduction
page.content:
The area lies to the north-west of Dorchester and it consists mostly of farmland. The combination of the chalk soil and the rivers flowing through it have given this area its chief characteristics: grassy downland with narrow valleys running through it.
The River Frome runs through the southern part towards Dorchester. The Frome has broken up into several streams and formed some fascinating meanders. Running from north to south, the River Cerne has created a narrow valley. Fishing is often carried out in these rivers.
Over the hilly downland between these rivers, there are several public paths which are popular with walkers and ramblers.
